meanings.definition: The position or duties of a monitor.
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, the students take turns holding the monitorships to help the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The monitorships in the office involve checking the security cameras regularly.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the monitorships of keeping score was given to the most competitive player.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style in the group project resembled the monitorships of a captain on a ship.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of the monitorships requires attention to detail and organization.

meanings.definition: The act of monitoring or overseeing a situation.
meanings.sent1: The security guard's monitorships of the building ensured everyone's safety.
meanings.sent2: The monitorships of the traffic flow helped prevent accidents on the busy road.
meanings.sent3: His monitorships of the cookie jar was comical as he tried to catch his sneaky cat in the act.
meanings.sent4: The monitorships of the forest by the park ranger revealed the presence of rare wildlife.
meanings.sent5: The diligent monitorships of the patient's vital signs by the nurse saved lives in the hospital.

meanings.definition: A program or arrangement in which a third party monitors and ensures compliance with legal requirements.
meanings.sent1: The company hired a firm to handle the monitorships of their environmental practices.
meanings.sent2: The monitorships of the financial transactions were crucial to prevent fraud.
meanings.sent3: The monitorships of the speed limit on the highway were like having a strict parent watching over.
meanings.sent4: The monitorships of the online activity protected users from potential cyber threats.
meanings.sent5: The monitorships of the construction site upheld safety regulations and standards.
